title: Panasonic Lumix G X Vario PZ 14-42mm
text: The Panasonic Lumix G X Vario PZ 14-42mm is a <a href="zoom%20lens">zoom lens</a> in the <a href="Micro%20Four%20Thirds">Micro Four Thirds</a> <a href="System%20camera">system</a>. It is a "standard zoom"- ranging from moderately <a href="Wide-angle%20lens">wide</a> to moderately <a href="Telephoto%20lens">tele</a>. An unusual feature is that the lens collapses to <a href="Pancake%20lens">pancake</a> size. To do so, focus-by-wire and power zoom are manually controlled by two thumb levers, not grip rings. There is no hardware switch for <a href="Image%20stabilization">O.I.S</a>, instead being controlled via the camera body. Panasonic's "HD" branding indicates focus and zoom motors are quiet, for videography. The optics contain Panasonic's "nano <a href="Anti-reflection%20coating">surface coating</a>".
